trans-unit.source: Usage note: Do not use this attribute, as it has been deprecated: the <ul> element should be styled using CSS. To give a similar effect as the compact attribute, the CSS property line-height can be used with a value of 80%.

trans-unit.source: Usage note: Do not use this element. Though present in early HTML specifications, it has been deprecated in HTML 4, and has since been removed entirely. No major browsers support this element.

trans-unit.source: Usage note: This attribute must not be used to convey semantic information. Even if all styling is removed, a page should remain semantically correct. Typically it shouldn't be used to hide irrelevant information; this should be done using the hidden attribute.

Usage note: This attribute must not be used to convey semantic information. Even if all styling is removed, a page should remain semantically correct. Typically it shouldn't be used to hide irrelevant information; this should be done using the hidden attribute.

trans-unit.source: Usage note: Do not use this attribute, as it has been deprecated. The <table> element should be styled using CSS. To create an effect similar to the border attribute, the border, border-color, border-width and border-styleCSS properties should be used.

trans-unit.source: Usage note: Do not use this attribute, as it has been deprecated. The <table> element should be styled using CSS. trans-unit.source: Usage note: Do not use this attribute, as it has been deprecated. The <table> element should be styled using CSS. trans-unit.target: Nota de uso: no utilice este atributo, ya que ha quedado obsoleto. El elemento <table> se debe diseñar con CSS . trans-unit.source: A DOMString indicating the number of characters on the tail end of the column's data should be displayed after the alignment character specified by the char attribute. For example, when displaying money values for currencies that use hundredths of a unit (such as the dollar, which is divided into 100 cents), you would typically specify a value of 2, so that in tandem with char being set to ".", the values in a column would be cleanly aligned on the decimal points, with the number of cents properly displayed to the right of the decimal point.
trans-unit.target: Una DOMString que indique el número de caracteres en el final de los datos de la columna debe mostrarse después del carácter de alineación especificado por el atributo char . Por ejemplo, al mostrar valores monetarios para monedas que usan centésimas de una unidad (como el dólar, que se divide en 100 centavos), normalmente debe especificar un valor de 2, de modo que junto con char se establezca en "." , los valores en una columna se alinearían limpiamente en los puntos decimales, con la cantidad de centavos mostrada correctamente a la derecha del punto decimal.

trans-unit.source: A <ruby> element. <rp> must be positioned immediately before or after an <rt> element.

trans-unit.source: A <table> element, as its first descendant.

trans-unit.source: A <table> element. The <colgroup> must appear after any optional <caption> element but before any <thead>, <th>, <tbody>, <tfoot> and <tr> element.
trans-unit.target: Un elemento <table> . El <colgroup> debe aparecer después de cualquier elemento <caption> opcional pero antes de cualquier elemento <thead> , <th> , <tbody> , <tfoot> y <tr> .

trans-unit.target: Un elemento <table> . El <tfoot> debe aparecer después de cualquier elemento <caption> , <colgroup> , <thead> , <tbody> o <tr> . Tenga en cuenta que este es el requisito de HTML5.

trans-unit.target: Un elemento <tr> .

trans-unit.source: A <link> element can occur either in the <head> or <body> element, depending on whether it has a link type that is body-ok. For example, the stylesheet link type is body-ok, and therefore <link rel="stylesheet"> is permitted in the body. However, this isn't a good practice to follow; it makes more sense to separate your <link> elements from your body content, putting them in the <head>.
trans-unit.target: Un elemento <link> puede aparecer en el elemento <head> o <body> , dependiendo de si tiene un tipo de enlace que es body-ok . Por ejemplo, el tipo de vínculo de la stylesheet es body-ok y, por lo tanto, se permite <link rel="stylesheet"> en el cuerpo. Sin embargo, esta no es una buena práctica a seguir; tiene más sentido separar sus elementos <link> del contenido de su cuerpo, colocándolos en el <head> .

trans-unit.source: A <noframes> element can contain any HTML elements that are allowed within the body of an HTML document, with the exception of the <frameset> and <frame> elements, since using frames when they aren't supported doesn't make sense.
trans-unit.target: Un elemento <noframes> puede contener cualquier elemento HTML que se permita dentro del cuerpo de un documento HTML, con la excepción de los elementos <frameset> y <frame> , ya que usar marcos cuando no son compatibles no tiene sentido.

trans-unit.source: A <summary> element may only be used as the first child of a <details> element. When the user clicks on the summary, the parent <details> element is toggled open or closed, and then a toggle event is sent to the <details> element, which can be used to let you know when this state change occurs.
trans-unit.target: Un elemento <summary> solo puede usarse como el primer hijo de un elemento <details> . Cuando el usuario hace clic en el resumen, el elemento principal <details> se abre o se cierra, y luego se envía un evento de toggle al elemento <details> , que se puede usar para avisarle cuando ocurre este cambio de estado.

trans-unit.source: A media element cannot have more than one track with the same kind, srclang, and label.
trans-unit.target: Un elemento media no puede tener más de una track con el mismo kind , srclang y label .

trans-unit.source: A name attribute to set the name of the associated data point submitted to the server when the form is submitted.

A rel value of preload indicates that the browser should preload this resource (see Preloading content with rel="preload" for more details), with the as attribute indicating the specific class of content being fetched. The crossorigin attribute indicates whether the resource should be fetched with a CORS request.

A rel value of preload indicates that the browser should preload this resource (see Preloading content with rel="preload" for more details), with the as attribute indicating the specific class of content being fetched. The crossorigin attribute indicates whether the resource should be fetched with a CORS request.
trans-unit.target: Un valor rel de preload indica que el navegador debe precargar este recurso (consulte Precarga de contenido con rel = "preload" para obtener más detalles), con el atributo as indicando la clase específica de contenido que se está obteniendo. El atributo crossorigin indica si el recurso debe buscarse con una solicitud CORS.

trans-unit.source: A role attribute of value search on the <form> element will cause screenreaders to announce that the form is a search form.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo de role de search de valor en el elemento <form> hará que los lectores de pantalla anuncien que el formulario es un formulario de búsqueda.

trans-unit.source: A tabindex of 0 means that the element should be focusable and should be reachable by sequential keyboard navigation, but that the tab order is left up to the user agent, which should apply the user's platform conventions. This is usually the best value to use when you want an element to be focusable and to participate in keyboard navigation rather than trying to manage the tab order yourself.
trans-unit.target: Un tabindex de 0 significa que el elemento debe poder enfocarse y debe ser accesible mediante la navegación secuencial del teclado, pero que el orden de tabulación se deja en manos del agente de usuario , que debe aplicar las convenciones de la plataforma del usuario. Este suele ser el mejor valor para usar cuando desea que un elemento sea enfocable y participe en la navegación con el teclado en lugar de intentar administrar el orden de tabulación usted mismo.

trans-unit.source: A context menu is a menu that appears upon user interaction, such as a right-click. HTML5 now allows us to customize this menu. Here are some implementation examples, including nested menus.
trans-unit.target: Un menú contextual es un menú que aparece tras la interacción del usuario, como un clic derecho. HTML5 ahora nos permite personalizar este menú. A continuación se muestran algunos ejemplos de implementación, incluidos los menús anidados.

trans-unit.source: A negative value (usually tabindex="-1") means that the element is not reachable via sequential keyboard navigation, but could be focused with Javascript or visually by clicking with the mouse. It's mostly useful to create accessible widgets with JavaScript.

A negative value (usually tabindex="-1") means that the element should be focusable, but should not be reachable via sequential keyboard navigation. It's mostly useful to create accessible widgets with JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: Un valor negativo (normalmente tabindex="-1" ) significa que el elemento debe poder enfocarse, pero no debe ser accesible a través de la navegación secuencial del teclado. Es más útil crear widgets accesibles con JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: A positive value means the element should be focusable in sequential keyboard navigation, with its order defined by the value of the number. That is, tabindex="4" is focused before tabindex="5" and tabindex="0", but after tabindex="3". If multiple elements share the same positive tabindex value, their order relative to each other follows their position in the document source. The maximum value for tabindex is 32767. If not specified, it takes the default value 0.

A positive value means the element should be focusable in sequential keyboard navigation, with its order defined by the value of the number. That is, tabindex="4" would be focused before tabindex="5", but after tabindex="3". If multiple elements share the same positive tabindex value, their order relative to each other follows their position in the document source.
trans-unit.target: Un valor positivo significa que el elemento debe poder enfocarse en la navegación secuencial del teclado, con su orden definido por el valor del número. Es decir, tabindex="4" se tabindex="5" antes de tabindex = "5" , pero después de tabindex="3" . Si varios elementos comparten el mismo valor de tabindex positivo , su orden relativo entre sí sigue su posición en el origen del documento.

trans-unit.source: A seek operation began.
A seek operation completed.
A named slot is a <slot> element with a name attribute.
trans-unit.target: Una ranura con nombre es un elemento <slot> con un atributo de name .

trans-unit.source: A keyword or author-defined name of the default browsing context to show the results of navigation from <a>, <area>, or <form> elements without explicit target attributes.

A leap year is any year which is divisible by 400 or the year is divisible by 4 but not by 100. Although the calendar year is normally 365 days long, it actually takes the planet Earth approximately 365.2422 days to complete a single orbit around the sun. Leap years help to adjust the calendar to keep it synchronized with the actual position of the planet in its orbit. Adding a day to the year every four years essentially makes the average year 365.25 days long, which is close to correct.
A skip link is a link placed as early as possible in <body> content that points to the beginning of the page's main content. Usually, CSS hides a skip link offscreen until focused.

A unique file type specifier is a string that describes a type of file that may be selected by the user in an <input> element of type file. Each unique file type specifier may take one of the following forms:

trans-unit.source: A valid month string consists of a valid year number (a string of at least four digits), followed by a hyphen character ("-", or U+002D), followed by a two-digit numeric month number, where 01 represents January and 12 represents December.
A Boolean attribute controlling whether or not the value is read-only
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que controla si el valor es de slo lectura o no

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute indicates that the element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant. For example, it can be used to hide elements of the page that can't be used until the login process has been completed. The browser won't render such elements. This attribute must not be used to hide content that could legitimately be shown.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano indica que el elemento aún no es o ya no es relevante . Por ejemplo, se puede utilizar para ocultar elementos de la página que no se pueden utilizar hasta que se haya completado el proceso de inicio de sesión. El navegador no representará tales elementos. Este atributo no debe utilizarse para ocultar contenido que podría mostrarse legítimamente.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute indicating that an option with a non-empty string value must be selected.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que indica que debe seleccionarse una opcin con un valor de cadena no vaca.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute indicating that the video is to be played "inline", that is within the element's playback area. Note that the absence of this attribute does not imply that the video will always be played in fullscreen.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que indica que el video se reproducirá "en línea", es decir, dentro del área de reproducción del elemento. Tenga en cuenta que la ausencia de este atributo no implica que el video siempre se reproducirá en pantalla completa.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute indicating whether or not the contents of the input should be read-only
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que indica si el contenido de la entrada debe ser de slo lectura o no

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute indicating whether or not this checkbox is checked by default (when the page loads). It does not indicate whether this checkbox is currently checked: if the checkbox’s state is changed, this content attribute does not reflect the change. (Only the HTMLInputElement’s checked IDL attribute is updated.)
A Boolean attribute indicating whether or not this checkbox is currently selected (checked).
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que indica si esta casilla de verificacin est actualmente seleccionada (marcada).

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute indicating whether the value is read-only
A Boolean attribute specifying that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If this attribute is specified, it overrides the novalidate attribute of the element's form owner.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que especifica que el formulario no se validará cuando se envíe. Si se especifica este atributo, anula el atributo novalidate del propietario del formulario del elemento.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute that indicates the default setting of the audio contained in the video. If set, the audio will be initially silenced. Its default value is false, meaning that the audio will be played when the video is played.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que indica la configuración predeterminada del audio contenido en el video. Si está configurado, el audio se silenciará inicialmente. Su valor predeterminado es false , lo que significa que el audio se reproducirá cuando se reproduzca el video.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute that indicates whether the audio will be initially silenced. Its default value is false.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que indica si el audio se silenciará inicialmente. Su valor predeterminado es false .

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute used to disable the capability of remote playback in devices that are attached using wired (HDMI, DVI, etc.) and wireless technologies (Miracast, Chromecast, DLNA, AirPlay, etc).

A Boolean attribute used to disable the capability of remote playback in devices that are attached using wired (HDMI, DVI, etc.) and wireless technologies (Miracast, Chromecast, DLNA, AirPlay, etc). See this proposed specification for more information.

A Boolean attribute which if true indicates that the element should automatically toggle picture-in-picture mode when the user switches back and forth between this document and another document or application.
A Boolean attribute which is present if the input should be disabled
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que est presente si la entrada debe ser desactivada

trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que,de estar presente,indica que el contenido del campo no debe ser editable por el usuario

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute which, if present, indicates that the input should automatically have focus when the page has finished loading (or when the <dialog> containing the element has been displayed).

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute which, if present, indicates that the user can enter a list of multiple e-mail addresses, separated by commas and, optionally, whitespace characters. See Allowing multiple e-mail addresses for an example, or HTML attribute: multiple for more details.

A Boolean attribute which, if present, indicates that the user can enter a list of multiple e-mail addresses, separated by commas and, optionally, whitespace characters. See Allowing multiple e-mail addresses for details.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que, si está presente, indica que el usuario puede ingresar una lista de múltiples direcciones de correo electrónico, separadas por comas y, opcionalmente, espacios en blanco. Consulte Permitir varias direcciones de correo electrónico para obtener más detalles.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute which, if present, indicates that the user should not be able to edit the value of the input. The readonly attribute is supported text, search, url, tel, email, date, month, week, time, datetime-local, number, and password input types.

A Boolean attribute which, if present, indicates that the user should not be able to interact with the input. Disabled inputs are typically rendered with a dimmer color or using some other form of indication that the field is not available for use.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que,si est presente,indica que el usuario no debe poder interactuar con la entrada.Las entradas deshabilitadas se muestran tpicamente con un color ms tenue o utilizando alguna otra forma de indicacin de que el campo no est disponible para su uso.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute which, if present, indicates that this radio button is the currently selected one in the group.Delete Rows

A Boolean attribute which, if present, means this field cannot be edited by the user. Its value can, however, still be changed by JavaScript code directly setting the HTMLInputElement.value property.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute which, if present, means this field cannot be edited by the user. Its value can, however, still be changed from JavaScript code that directly sets the value of the HTMLInputElement.value property.
trans-unit.target: Un atributo booleano que, si está presente, significa que el usuario no puede editar este campo. Sin embargo, su value aún se puede cambiar desde el código JavaScript que establece directamente el valor de la propiedad HTMLInputElement.value .

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute which, if present, specifies that the form should not be validated before submission to the server. This overrides the value of the novalidate attribute on the element's owning form.

trans-unit.source: A Boolean attribute: if specified, the audio player will automatically seek back to the start upon reaching the end of the audio.

trans-unit.target: Un URL para que una imagen se muestre mientras se descarga el video.Si no se especifica este atributo,no se muestra nada hasta que el primer fotograma est disponible,entonces el primer fotograma se muestra como el marco del pster.

trans-unit.source: A URL for an instant messaging protocol endpoint, such as "xmpp:username@example.net".
trans-unit.target: Una URL para un punto final del protocolo de mensajera instantnea,como "xmpp:username@example.net".

trans-unit.source: A URL fragment is a name preceded by a hash mark (#), which specifies an internal target location (an ID of an HTML element) within the current document. URLs are not restricted to Web (HTTP)-based documents, but can use any protocol supported by the browser. For example, file:, ftp:, and mailto: work in most browsers.
trans-unit.target: Un fragmento de URL es un nombre precedido por una marca de almohadilla ( # ), que especifica una ubicación de destino interna (una ID de un elemento HTML) dentro del documento actual. Las URL no están restringidas a documentos basados en Web (HTTP), pero pueden usar cualquier protocolo compatible con el navegador. Por ejemplo, file: , ftp: y mailto: funcionan en la mayoría de los navegadores.

trans-unit.source: A URL indicating a poster frame to show until the user plays or seeks.
trans-unit.target: Una URL que indica un marco de pster para mostrar hasta que el usuario juegue o busque.

trans-unit.source: A URL is constructed by starting with the URL given by the formaction or action attribute, appending a question mark ("?") character, then appending the form's data, encoded as described by formenctype or the form's enctype attribute. This URL is then sent to the server using an HTTP get request. This method works well for simple forms that contain only ASCII characters and have no side effects. This is the default value.
trans-unit.target: Una URL se construye comenzando con la URL dada por el formaction o action , agregando un signo de interrogación ("?"), Luego agregando los datos del formulario, codificados como se describe en formenctype o el atributo enctype del formulario . Esta URL luego se envía al servidor mediante una solicitud HTTP get . Este método funciona bien para formularios simples que contienen solo caracteres ASCII y no tienen efectos secundarios. Este es el valor predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: A URL of a long description of the frame's content. Due to widespread misuse, this is not helpful for non-visual browsers.
A URL that designates a source document or message for the information quoted. This attribute is intended to point to information explaining the context or the reference for the quote.

A button that submits the form.

A cache manifest file can include three sections (CACHE, NETWORK, and FALLBACK, discussed below). In the example above, there is no section header, so all data lines are assumed to be in the explicit (CACHE) section, meaning that the browser should cache all the listed resources in the application cache. Resources can be specified using either absolute or relative URLs (e.g., index.html).
trans-unit.target: Un archivo de manifiesto de caché puede incluir tres secciones ( CACHE , NETWORK y FALLBACK , que se describen a continuación). En el ejemplo anterior, no hay un encabezado de sección, por lo que se supone que todas las líneas de datos están en la sección explícita ( CACHE ), lo que significa que el navegador debe almacenar en caché todos los recursos enumerados en la caché de la aplicación. Los recursos se pueden especificar utilizando URL absolutas o relativas (por ejemplo, index.html ).

trans-unit.source: A canonical link element is an HTML element that helps webmasters prevent duplicate content issues by specifying the "canonical" or "preferred" version of a web page as part of search engine optimization.
trans-unit.target: Un elemento de enlace cannico es un elemento HTML que ayuda a los webmasters a evitar problemas de contenido duplicado especificando la versin "cannica" o "preferida" de una pgina web como parte de la optimizacin de los motores de bsqueda.

trans-unit.source: A caption can be associated with the <figure> element by inserting a <figcaption> inside it (as the first or the last child).
trans-unit.target: Se puede asociar un título con el elemento <figure> insertando un <figcaption> dentro de él (como el primer o el último hijo).

trans-unit.source: A caption can be associated with the <figure> element by inserting a <figcaption> inside it (as the first or the last child). The first <figcaption> element found in the figure is presented as the figure's caption.
A challenge string that is submitted along with the public key.
trans-unit.target: Una cuerda de desafo que se presenta junto con la llave pblica.

trans-unit.target: Una cuerda de desafo que se presenta junto con la llave pblica.Por defecto es una cadena vaca si no se especifica.

trans-unit.source: A character indicating the sign of the offset: the plus character ("+", or U+002B) for time zones to the east of the prime meridian or the minus character ("-", or U+002D) for time zones to the west of the prime meridian.
A check box allowing single values to be selected/deselected.
A checkbox in the indeterminate state has a horizontal line in the box (it looks somewhat like a hyphen or minus sign) instead of a check/tick in most browsers.
trans-unit.target: Una casilla de verificacin en estado indeterminado tiene una lnea horizontal en la casilla (se parece un poco a un guin o un signo menos)en lugar de una marca de verificacin en la mayora de los navegadores.

trans-unit.source: A class for the contact.
trans-unit.target: Una clase para el contacto.

trans-unit.source: A color in hexadecimal string notation always begins with the character "#". After that come the hexadecimal digits of the color code. The string is case-insensitive.
trans-unit.target: Un color en notación de cadena hexadecimal siempre comienza con el carácter "#" . Después vienen los dígitos hexadecimales del código de color. La cadena no distingue entre mayúsculas y minúsculas.

trans-unit.source: A color input's value is considered to be invalid if the user agent is unable to convert the user's input into seven-character lower-case hexadecimal notation. If and when this is the case, the :invalid pseudo-class is applied to the element.
trans-unit.target: El valor de una entrada de color se considera inválido si el agente de usuario no puede convertir la entrada del usuario en una notación hexadecimal minúscula de siete caracteres. Si este es el caso, la :invalid se aplica al elemento.

trans-unit.source: A color that comes from imagery associated with what your content is about. If you're creating a web site about a given item or product, choose a color that's physically present on that item.

trans-unit.source: A color that comes from imagery associated with what your content is about. If you're creating a website about a given item or product, choose a color that's physically present on that item.
A color that is naturally associated with the topic of your content, such as the existing color identified with a product or idea or a color representative of the emotion you wish to convey.

trans-unit.source: A combination of the <figure> and <figcaption> elements, supplemented by a combination of an id and the ARIArole and aria-labelledby attributes allow the preformatted text to be announced as an image, with the figcaption serving as the image's alternate description.
trans-unit.target: Una combinación de los elementos <figure> y <figcaption> , complementada con una combinación de un id y el role ARIA y aria-labelledby atributos aria-labelledby permiten que el texto preformateado se anuncie como una imagen, con figcaption sirviendo como descripción alternativa de la imagen.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of content types that the server accepts.
trans-unit.target: Una lista separada por comas de los tipos de contenido que el servidor acepta.

trans-unit.source: A comma-separated list of selectors. These have the same syntax as CSS selectors. They select the content to insert in place of the <content> element.
trans-unit.target: Una lista de selectores separados por comas. Estos tienen la misma sintaxis que los selectores CSS. Seleccionan el contenido para insertar en lugar del elemento <content> .

trans-unit.source: A command can either be defined explicitly, with a textual label and optional icon to describe its appearance, or alternatively as an indirect command whose behavior is defined by a separate element. Commands can also optionally include a checkbox or be grouped to share radio buttons. (Menu items for indirect commands gain checkboxes or radio buttons when defined against elements <input type="checkbox"> and <input type="radio">.)
trans-unit.target: Un comando puede definirse explícitamente, con una etiqueta textual y un icono opcional para describir su apariencia, o alternativamente como un comando indirecto cuyo comportamiento está definido por un elemento separado. Los comandos también pueden incluir opcionalmente una casilla de verificación o agruparse para compartir botones de opción. (Los elementos del menú para los comandos indirectos ganan casillas de verificación o botones de opción cuando se definen con los elementos <input type="checkbox"> y <input type="radio"> ).

trans-unit.source: A common navigation technique for users of assistive technology is to read the page title and infer the content the page contains. This is because navigating into a page to determine its content can be a time consuming and potentially confusing process.

A common navigation technique for users of assistive technology is to read the page title and infer which content it contains. This is because navigating a page to determine its content can be a time consuming and potentially confusing process.
trans-unit.target: Una tcnica de navegacin comn para los usuarios de la tecnologa de asistencia es leer el ttulo de la pgina e inferir qu contenido contiene.Esto se debe a que navegar por una pgina para determinar su contenido puede ser un proceso largo y potencialmente confuso.

trans-unit.source: A common navigation technique for users of screen reading software is jumping from heading to heading to quickly determine the content of the page. Because of this, it is important to not skip one or more heading levels. Doing so may create confusion, as the person navigating this way may be left wondering where the missing heading is.
trans-unit.target: Una tcnica de navegacin comn para los usuarios de software de lectura de pantalla es saltar de un encabezamiento a otro para determinar rpidamente el contenido de la pgina.Debido a esto,es importante no saltarse uno o ms niveles de encabezamiento.Hacerlo puede crear confusin,ya que la persona que navega de esta manera puede quedarse preguntndose dnde est el encabezamiento que falta.

trans-unit.target: El nombre de una empresa u organizacin,como "Acme Widget Company" o "Girl Scouts of America".

trans-unit.source: A control for entering a date (year, month, and day, with no time). Opens a date picker or numeric wheels for year, month, day when active in supporting browsers.
A control for entering a date and time (hour, minute, second, and fraction of a second) based on UTC time zone.
A control for entering a date and time, with no time zone. Opens a date picker or numeric wheels for date- and time-components when active in supporting browsers.
A control for entering a date consisting of a week-year number and a week number with no time zone.
A control for entering a month and year, with no time zone.

A control for entering a number whose exact value is not important. Displays as a range widget defaulting to the middle value. Used in conjunction min and max to define the range of acceptable values.
A control for entering a number. Displays a spinner and adds default validation when supported. Displays a numeric keypad in some devices with dynamic keypads.
A control for entering a telephone number. Displays a telephone keypad in some devices with dynamic keypads.
A control for entering a time value with no time zone.
A control for specifying a color; opening a color picker when active in supporting browsers.
A control that is not displayed but whose value is submitted to the server. There is an example in the next column, but it's hidden!
A control that lets the user select a file. Use the accept attribute to define the types of files that the control can select.
A country code.

trans-unit.source: A cross-origin request (i.e. with an Origin HTTP header) is performed, but no credential is sent (i.e. no cookie, X.509 certificate, or HTTP Basic authentication). If the server does not give credentials to the origin site (by not setting the Access-Control-Allow-Origin HTTP header) the image will be tainted and its usage restricted.
trans-unit.target: Se realiza una solicitud de origen cruzado (es decir, con un encabezado HTTP de Origin ), pero no se envía ninguna credencial (es decir, no se envía ninguna cookie, certificado X.509 o autenticación básica HTTP). Si el servidor no proporciona credenciales al sitio de origen (al no configurar el encabezado HTTP Access-Control-Allow-Origin ), la imagen se corromperá y se restringirá su uso.

trans-unit.source: A cross-origin request (i.e. with an Origin HTTP header) is performed, but no credential is sent (i.e. no cookie, X.509 certificate, or HTTP Basic authentication). If the server does not give credentials to the origin site (by not setting the Access-Control-Allow-Origin HTTP header) the resource will be tainted and its usage restricted.

A cross-origin request (i.e. with an Origin HTTP header) is performed along with a credential sent (i.e. a cookie, certificate, and/or HTTP Basic authentication is performed). If the server does not give credentials to the origin site (through Access-Control-Allow-Credentials HTTP header), the resource will be tainted and its usage restricted.

A cross-origin request (i.e. with an Origin HTTP header) is performed along with a credential sent (i.e. a cookie, certificate, and/or HTTP Basic authentication is performed). If the server does not give credentials to the origin site (through Access-Control-Allow-Credentials HTTP header), the resource will be tainted and its usage restricted.
trans-unit.target: Se realiza una solicitud de origen cruzado (es decir, con un encabezado HTTP de Origin ) junto con una credencial enviada (es decir, se realiza una cookie, certificado y / o autenticación básica HTTP). Si el servidor no proporciona credenciales al sitio de origen (a través del encabezado HTTP Access-Control-Allow-Credentials ), el recurso se contaminará y se restringirá su uso.

trans-unit.source: A cross-origin request (i.e., with Origin: HTTP header) is performed, but no credential is sent (i.e., no cookie, X.509 certificate, or HTTP Basic authentication). If the server does not give credentials to the origin site (by not setting the Access-Control-Allow-Origin HTTP header), the image will be tainted and its usage restricted.
trans-unit.target: Se realiza una solicitud de origen cruzado (es decir, con el encabezado Origin: HTTP), pero no se envía ninguna credencial (es decir, no se envía ninguna cookie, certificado X.509 o autenticación básica HTTP). Si el servidor no proporciona credenciales al sitio de origen (al no configurar el encabezado HTTP Access-Control-Allow-Origin ), la imagen se corromperá y se restringirá su uso.

trans-unit.source: A cross-origin request (i.e., with the Origin HTTP header) performed along with credentials sent (i.e., a cookie, certificate, or HTTP Basic authentication). If the server does not give credentials to the origin site (through the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials HTTP header), the image will be tainted and its usage restricted.
trans-unit.target: Una solicitud de origen cruzado (es decir, con el encabezado HTTP de Origin ) realizada junto con las credenciales enviadas (es decir, una cookie, certificado o autenticación básica HTTP). Si el servidor no proporciona credenciales al sitio de origen (a través del encabezado HTTP Access-Control-Allow-Credentials ), la imagen se corromperá y se restringirá su uso.

trans-unit.source: A cryptographic nonce (number used once) to whitelist inline scripts in a script-src Content-Security-Policy. The server must generate a unique nonce value each time it transmits a policy. It is critical to provide a nonce that cannot be guessed as bypassing a resource's policy is otherwise trivial.
trans-unit.target: Un nonce criptográfico (número usado una vez) para incluir en la lista blanca scripts en línea en un script-src Content-Security-Policy . El servidor debe generar un valor nonce único cada vez que transmite una política. Es fundamental proporcionar un nonce que no se pueda adivinar, ya que omitir la política de un recurso es trivial.

trans-unit.source: A cryptographic nonce (number used once) to whitelist scripts in a script-src Content-Security-Policy. The server must generate a unique nonce value each time it transmits a policy. It is critical to provide a nonce that cannot be guessed as bypassing a resource's policy is otherwise trivial.

A cryptographic nonce (number used once) used to whitelist inline styles in a style-src Content-Security-Policy. The server must generate a unique nonce value each time it transmits a policy. It is critical to provide a nonce that cannot be guessed as bypassing a resource’s policy is otherwise trivial.
trans-unit.target: Un nonce criptográfico (número usado una vez) que se usa para incluir estilos en línea en la lista blanca en una política de seguridad de contenido de style-src . El servidor debe generar un valor nonce único cada vez que transmite una política. Es fundamental proporcionar un nonce que no se pueda adivinar, ya que omitir la política de un recurso es trivial.

trans-unit.source: A disclosure widget is typically presented onscreen using a small triangle which rotates (or twists) to indicate open/closed status, with a label next to the triangle. If the first child of the <details> element is a <summary>, the contents of the <summary> element are used as the label for the disclosure widget.
trans-unit.target: Un widget de divulgación generalmente se presenta en pantalla usando un pequeño triángulo que gira (o gira) para indicar el estado abierto / cerrado, con una etiqueta al lado del triángulo. Si el primer hijo del elemento <details> es un <summary> , el contenido del elemento <summary> se usa como etiqueta para el widget de divulgación.

trans-unit.source: A document may have several <nav> elements, for example, one for site navigation and one for intra-page navigation. aria-labelledby can be used in such case to promote accessibility, see example.

trans-unit.source: A double-precision floating-point value which indicates the duration (total length) of the audio in seconds, on the media's timeline. If no media is present on the element, or the media is not valid, the returned value is NaN. If the media has no known end (such as for live streams of unknown duration, web radio, media incoming from WebRTC, and so forth), this value is +Infinity.

A double-precision floating-point value which indicates the duration (total length) of the media in seconds, on the media's timeline. trans-unit.source: A name for the embedded browsing context (or frame). También se puede utilizar como valor del parámetro windowName en el método window.open() .

trans-unit.source: A name or keyword indicating the default location to display the result when hyperlinks or forms cause navigation, for elements that do not have an explicit target reference. trans-unit.source: A negative value is useful when you have off-screen content that appears on a specific event. The user won't be able to focus any element with a negative tabindex using the keyboard, but a script can do so by calling the focus()method.

A negative value of tabindex indicates that the element should be focusable by the user, but not using sequential keyboard navigation. It's recommended to always use a value of -1 as using other values can be complicated.
trans-unit.target: Un valor negativo de tabindex indica que el usuario debe poder enfocar el elemento, pero sin utilizar la navegación secuencial del teclado. Se recomienda usar siempre un valor de -1 ya que usar otros valores puede ser complicado.

trans-unit.source: A new password. This may be used by the browser both to avoid accidentally filling in an existing password and to offer assistance in creating a secure password.

May include a delete icon in supporting browsers that can be used to clear the field. Displays a search icon instead of enter key on some devices with dynamic keypads.
A single-line text field whose value is obscured. Will alert user if site is not secure.

A skip link, also known as skipnav, is an a element placed as close as possible to the opening <body> element that links to the beginning of the page's main content. This link allows people to bypass content repeated throughout multiple pages on a website, such as a website's header and primary navigation.
trans-unit.target: Un salto de enlace, también conocido como skipnav, es un a elemento colocado lo más cerca posible a la apertura <body> elemento que se vincula al comienzo del contenido principal de la página. Este enlace permite a las personas omitir el contenido repetido en varias páginas de un sitio web, como el encabezado y la navegación principal de un sitio web.

A space- or comma-delimited list of character encodings that the server accepts. The browser uses them in the order in which they are listed. The default value, the reserved string "UNKNOWN", indicates the same encoding as that of the document containing the form element.
trans-unit.target: Una lista delimitada por espacios o comas de codificaciones de caracteres que acepta el servidor. El navegador los usa en el orden en que aparecen en la lista. trans-unit.source: A string specifying a name for the input control. This name is submitted along with the control's value when the form data is submitted, as well as with the owning <form> element's elements object.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica un nombre para el control de entrada. Este nombre se envía junto con el valor del control cuando se envían los datos del formulario, así como con el objeto de elementos del elements <form> propietario .

trans-unit.source: A string specifying a name for the input control. This name is submitted along with the control's value when the form data is submitted.

A string specifying the <form> element with which the input is associated (that is, its form owner). This string's value, if present, must match the id of a <form> element in the same document. If this attribute isn't specified, the <input> element is associated with the nearest containing form, if any.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica el elemento <form> con el que está asociada la entrada (es decir, su propietario del formulario ). El valor de esta cadena, si está presente, debe coincidir con el id de un elemento <form> en el mismo documento. Si no se especifica este atributo, el elemento <input> se asocia con el formulario contenedor más cercano, si lo hubiera.

trans-unit.source: A string specifying the URL of the image file to display to represent the graphical submit button. When the user interacts with the image, the input is handled like any other button input.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica la URL del archivo de imagen a mostrar para representar el botn de envo grfico.Cuando el usuario interacta con la imagen,la entrada se maneja como cualquier otra entrada de botn.

trans-unit.source: A string specifying the earliest time to accept, given in the time value format described previously. If the value specified isn't a valid time string, no minimum value is set.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica la hora más temprana para aceptar, dada en el formato de valor de tiempo descrito anteriormente. Si el valor especificado no es una cadena de tiempo válida, no se establece ningún valor mínimo.

trans-unit.source: A string specifying the encoding type to use for the form data
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica el tipo de codificacin a utilizar para los datos del formulario

trans-unit.source: A string specifying the file's path relative to the base directory selected in a directory picker (that is, a file picker in which the webkitdirectory attribute is set). This is non-standard and should be used with caution.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica la ruta del archivo en relación con el directorio base seleccionado en un selector de directorio (es decir, un selector de file en el que se establece el atributo webkitdirectory ). Esto no es estándar y debe usarse con precaución.

trans-unit.source: A string specifying the type of control to render. For example, to create a checkbox, a value of checkbox is used. If omitted (or an unknown value is specified), the input type text is used, creating a plaintext input field.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica el tipo de control a representar. Por ejemplo, para crear una casilla de checkbox se utiliza un valor de casilla de verificación . Si se omite (o se especifica un valor desconocido), se utiliza el tipo de text o de entrada , creando un campo de entrada de texto sin formato.

trans-unit.source: A string that contains no "." (U+002E FULL STOP) characters and no ":" characters (U+003A COLON) and is used as a proprietary item property name (again, one not defined in a public specification).
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que no contiene caracteres " . " (U + 002E FULL STOP) ni caracteres " : " (U + 003A COLON) y se utiliza como un nombre de propiedad de elemento patentado (de nuevo, uno no definido en una especificación pública).

trans-unit.source: A string that defines the file types the file input should accept. This string is a comma-separated list of unique file type specifiers. Because a given file type may be identified in more than one manner, it's useful to provide a thorough set of type specifiers when you need files of a given format.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que define los tipos de archivo que la entrada del archivo debe aceptar. Esta cadena es una lista separada por comas de especificadores de tipo de archivo únicos . Debido a que un tipo de archivo determinado puede identificarse de más de una manera, es útil proporcionar un conjunto completo de especificadores de tipo cuando necesite archivos de un formato determinado.

trans-unit.source: A string that describes what if any type of autocomplete functionality the input should provide. A typical implementation of autocomplete simply recalls previous values entered in the same input field, but more complex forms of autocomplete can exist. For instance, a browser could integrate with a device's contacts list to autocomplete email addresses in an email input field. See Values in The HTML autocomplete attribute for permitted values.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que describe qué tipo de funcionalidad de autocompletar debería proporcionar la entrada. Una implementación típica de autocompletar simplemente recuerda los valores anteriores ingresados en el mismo campo de entrada, pero pueden existir formas más complejas de autocompletar. Por ejemplo, un navegador podría integrarse con la lista de contactos de un dispositivo para autocompletar direcciones de correo electrónico en un campo de entrada de correo electrónico. Consulte Valores en El atributo de autocompletar HTML para conocer los valores permitidos.

trans-unit.source: A string that identifies the encoding method to use when submitting the form data to the server. There are three permitted values:
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que identifica el mtodo de codificacin a utilizar cuando se envan los datos del formulario al servidor.Hay tres valores permitidos:

trans-unit.source: A string that specifies which camera to use for capture of image or video data, if the accept attribute indicates that the input should be of one of those types. A value of user indicates that the user-facing camera and/or microphone should be used. A value of environment specifies that the outward-facing camera and/or microphone should be used. If this attribute is missing, the user agent is free to decide on its own what to do. If the requested facing mode isn't available, the user agent may fall back to its preferred default mode.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica qué cámara usar para capturar datos de imagen o video, si el atributo de accept indica que la entrada debe ser de uno de esos tipos. Un valor de user indica que se debe utilizar la cámara y / o el micrófono de cara al usuario. Un valor de environment especifica que se debe utilizar la cámara y / o el micrófono orientados hacia el exterior. Si falta este atributo, el agente de usuario es libre de decidir por sí mismo qué hacer. Si el modo de orientación solicitado no está disponible, el agente de usuario puede volver a su modo predeterminado preferido.

trans-unit.source: A string to display to the user as an error message when the field doesn't pass validation. Firefox only.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que se muestra al usuario como un mensaje de error cuando el campo no pasa la validación. Solo en Firefox.

trans-unit.source: A string value of "any" means that no stepping is implied, and any value is allowed (barring other constraints, such as min and max).
trans-unit.target: Un valor de cadena de "any" significa que no se implica ningún paso, y se permite cualquier valor (salvo otras restricciones, como min y max ).

trans-unit.source: A string value of any means that no stepping is implied, and any value is allowed (barring other constraints, such as min and max).

A string which specifies a name or keyword that indicates where to display the response received after submitting the form. The string must be the name of a browsing context (that is, a tab, window, or <iframe>. A value specified here overrides any target given by the target attribute on the <form> that owns this input.
trans-unit.target: Una cadena que especifica un nombre o palabra clave que indica dónde mostrar la respuesta recibida después de enviar el formulario. La cadena debe ser el nombre de un contexto de exploración (es decir, una pestaña, ventana o <iframe> ) . Un valor especificado aquí anula cualquier objetivo dado por el atributo de target en el <form> que posee esta entrada.

trans-unit.source: A text string alternative to display on browsers that do not display images. The text should be phrased so that it presents the user with the same kind of choice as the image would offer when displayed without the alternative text. In HTML4, this attribute is required, but may be the empty string (""). In HTML5, this attribute is required only if the href attribute is used.

El texto debe estar redactado de manera que presente al usuario el mismo tipo de elección que ofrecería la imagen cuando se muestra sin el texto alternativo. En HTML4, este atributo es obligatorio, pero puede ser una cadena vacía (""). En HTML5, este atributo es obligatorio solo si se utiliza el atributo href .

trans-unit.source: A thread about isindex in November 1992, Kevin Hoadley questioned the need for an isindex element and proposed to drop it. He proposed to have instead an input element (idea supported by Steve Putz). Tim Berners-Lee explains the purpose of isindex resulting in aggregated search results. Kevin replies that he doesn't like the boolean nature of isindex and would prefer a system where everything is searchable and proposes to extend the current WWW Framework with a specific httpd configuration and defined that some URIs mapping create search queries.
trans-unit.target: En un hilo sobre isindex en noviembre de 1992, Kevin Hoadley cuestionó la necesidad de un elemento isindex y propuso eliminarlo. Propuso tener en su lugar un elemento de entrada (idea apoyada por Steve Putz). Tim Berners-Lee explica el propósito de isindex que genera resultados de búsqueda agregados. Kevin responde que no le gusta la naturaleza booleana de isindex y preferiría un sistema donde todo se pueda buscar y propone extender el marco WWW actual con una configuración httpd específica y definió que algunos mapas de URI crean consultas de búsqueda.

trans-unit.source: A time string can specify a time with precision to the minute, second, or to the millisecond. Specifying only the hour or minute isn't permitted. A valid time string minimally consists of a two-digit hour followed by a colon (":", U+003A), then a two-digit minute. The minute may optionally be followed by another colon and a two-digit number of seconds. Milliseconds may be specified, optionally, by adding a decimal point character (".", U+002E) followed by one, two, or three digits.

A time zone offset string specifies the offset in either a positive or a negative number of hours and minutes from the standard time base. There are two standard time bases, which are very close to the same, but not exactly the same:

trans-unit.source: After declaring a few variables, an event listener is added to the button to control the switching mechanism. This is pretty simple, mostly involving changing over the button's class and <label>, and updating the display values of the two sets of inputs when the button is pressed.

After declaring a few variables, we add an event listener to the button to control the switching mechanism. This is pretty simple, mostly involving changing over the button class and label, and updating the display values of the two sets of inputs when the button is pressed. Note that we're not converting back and forth between meters and feet/inches here, which a real-life web application would probably do.

trans-unit.source: An example for <i> could be: "The Queen Mary sailed last night". Here, there is no added emphasis or importance on the word "Queen Mary". trans-unit.source: Any request to http://www.example.com/example/bar/ or any of its subdirectories and their content cause the browser to issue a network request to attempt to load the requested resource. If the attempt fails, due to either a network failure or a server error of some kind, the browser loads the file example.html instead.
trans-unit.target: Cualquier solicitud a http://www.example.com/example/bar/ o cualquiera de sus subdirectorios y su contenido hace que el navegador emita una solicitud de red para intentar cargar el recurso solicitado. Si el intento falla, debido a una falla de la red o un error del servidor de algún tipo, el navegador carga el archivo example.html en su lugar.

trans-unit.source: Application cache implementation overview
trans-unit.target: Visin general de la implementacin de la cach de aplicaciones

trans-unit.source: Application caches can also become obsolete. If an application's manifest file is removed from the server, the browser removes all application caches that use that manifest, and sends an "obsoleted" event to the applicationCache object. This sets the application cache's state to OBSOLETE.
trans-unit.target: Los cachés de aplicaciones también pueden volverse obsoletos. Si el archivo de manifiesto de una aplicación se elimina del servidor, el navegador elimina todos los cachés de aplicaciones que usan ese manifiesto y envía un evento "obsoleto" al objeto applicationCache . Esto establece el estado de la caché de la aplicación en OBSOLETE .

trans-unit.source: Application caching lets web-based applications run offline. You can use the Application Cache (AppCache) interface to specify resources that the browser should cache and make available to offline users. Applications that are cached load and work correctly even if users click the refresh button when they are offline.
trans-unit.target: El almacenamiento en caché de aplicaciones permite que las aplicaciones basadas en web se ejecuten sin conexión. Puede utilizar la interfaz Application Cache ( AppCache ) para especificar los recursos que el navegador debe almacenar en caché y poner a disposición de los usuarios sin conexión. Las aplicaciones almacenadas en caché se cargan y funcionan correctamente incluso si los usuarios hacen clic en el botón de actualización cuando están desconectados.

trans-unit.source: As a "pure" container, the <div> element does not inherently represent anything. Instead, it's used to group content so it can be easily styled using the class or id attributes, marking a section of a document as being written in a different language (using the lang attribute), and so on.
trans-unit.target: Como contenedor "puro", el elemento <div> no representa inherentemente nada. En su lugar, se usa para agrupar contenido para que se pueda diseñar fácilmente usando los atributos class o id , marcando una sección de un documento como escrita en un idioma diferente (usando el atributo lang ), etc.

trans-unit.source: As a result, if the input value is invalid when the submit button is pressed, one of the custom error messages will be shown.

As a rule, if the user is more likely to be interested in the percentage of the distance between minimum and maximum values than the actual number itself, a range input is a great candidate. For example, in the case of a home stereo volume control, users typically think "set volume at halfway to maximum" instead of "set volume to 0.5".
trans-unit.target: Por regla general,si el usuario est ms interesado en el porcentaje de la distancia entre los valores mnimo y mximo que en el propio nmero real,una entrada de rango es un gran candidato.Por ejemplo,en el caso de un control de volumen de un equipo de sonido domstico,los usuarios suelen pensar en "ajustar el volumen a la mitad del mximo" en lugar de "ajustar el volumen a 0,5".

trans-unit.source: As is the case with other <input> types, there are two events that can be used to detect changes to the color value: input and change. input is fired on the <input> element every time the color changes. The change event is fired when the user dismisses the color picker. In both cases, you can determine the new value of the element by looking at its value.

As is the case with other <input> types, there are two events that can be used to detect changes to the color value: input and change. input is fired on the <input> element every time the color changes. The change event is fired when the user dismisses the color picker. In both cases, you can determine the new value of the element by looking at its value.

El evento de change se activa cuando el usuario descarta el selector de color. En ambos casos, puede determinar el nuevo valor del elemento mirando su value .

trans-unit.source: As soon as you draw into a canvas any data that was loaded from another origin without CORS approval, the canvas becomes tainted. A tainted canvas is one which is no longer considered secure, and any attempts to retrieve image data back from the canvas will cause an exception to be thrown.
trans-unit.target: Tan pronto como dibuja en un lienzo cualquier dato que se cargó desde otro origen sin la aprobación de CORS, el lienzo se contamina . Un lienzo contaminado es uno que ya no se considera seguro, y cualquier intento de recuperar datos de imagen del lienzo provocará que se genere una excepción.

trans-unit.source: As stated previously, placing the secret in a hidden input doesn't inherently make it secure. The key's composition and encoding would do that. The value of the hidden input is that it keeps the secret associated with the data and automatically includes it when the form is sent to the server. You need to use well-designed secrets to actually secure your website.
trans-unit.target: Como ya se ha dicho,colocar el secreto en una entrada oculta no lo hace intrnsecamente seguro.La composicin y la codificacin de la clave lo hara.El valor de la entrada oculta es que mantiene el secreto asociado a los datos y lo incluye automticamente cuando el formulario se enva al servidor.Necesitas usar secretos bien diseados para asegurar tu sitio web.

trans-unit.source: As the directionality of the text is semantically related to its content and not to its presentation, it is recommended that web developers use this attribute instead of the related CSS properties when possible. trans-unit.target: Como la direccionalidad del texto est semnticamente relacionada con su contenido y no con su presentacin,se recomienda que los desarrolladores web utilicen este atributo en lugar de las propiedades CSS relacionadas cuando sea posible.De esta manera,el texto se mostrar correctamente incluso en un navegador que no soporte CSS o que tenga el CSS desactivado.

trans-unit.source: As the example above shows, the <fieldset> element provides a grouping for a part of an HTML form, with a nested <legend> element providing a caption for the <fieldset>. It takes few attributes, the most notable of which are form, which can contain the id of a <form> on the same page, allowing you to make the <fieldset> part of that <form> even if it is not nested inside it, and disabled, which allows you to disable the <fieldset> and all its contents in one go.
trans-unit.target: Como muestra el ejemplo anterior, el elemento <fieldset> proporciona una agrupación para una parte de un formulario HTML, con un elemento <legend> anidado que proporciona un título para el <fieldset> . Toma pocos atributos, el más notable de los cuales es form ulario , que puede contener la id entificación de un <form> en la misma página, lo que le permite hacer que el <fieldset> forme parte de ese <form> incluso si no está anidado dentro de él. y disabled , lo que le permite deshabilitar <fieldset> y todo su contenido de una sola vez.

trans-unit.source: Audio with spoken dialog should provide both captions and transcripts that accurately describe its content. trans-unit.source: Authors should not use ASCII-incompatible encodings to avoid security risk: browsers not supporting them may interpret harmful content as HTML. This happens with the JIS_C6226-1983, JIS_X0212-1990, HZ-GB-2312, JOHAB, the ISO-2022 family and the EBCDIC family.
trans-unit.target: Los autores no deben utilizar codificaciones incompatibles con ASCII para evitar riesgos de seguridad: los navegadores que no las admitan pueden interpretar el contenido dañino como HTML. Because a disabled field cannot have its value changed, required does not have any effect on inputs with the disabled attribute also specified. Additionally, since the elements become immutable, most other attributes, such as pattern, have no effect, until the control is enabled.

Because a given file type may be identified in more than one manner, it's useful to provide a thorough set of type specifiers when you need files of specific type, or use the wild card to denote a type of any format is acceptable.
Because a read-only field cannot have a value, required does not have any effect on inputs with the readonly attribute also specified.
Because a read-only field cannot have it's value changed by a user interaction, required does not have any effect on inputs with the readonly attribute also specified.

Because each browsing context is a complete document environment, every <iframe> in a page requires increased memory and other computing resources. While theoretically you can use as many <iframe>s as you like, check for performance problems.

Because each embedded browsing context created by <iframe> is itself a complete document environment, every use of <iframe> within a page can cause substantial increases in the amount of memory and other computing resources required by the document overall, so while theoretically you can use as many <iframe> as you like on a page, you should keep the potential for performance issues in mind.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que cada contexto de navegación integrado creado por <iframe> es en sí mismo un entorno de documento completo, cada uso de <iframe> dentro de una página puede causar aumentos sustanciales en la cantidad de memoria y otros recursos informáticos requeridos por el documento en general, por lo que, aunque teóricamente puede use tantos <iframe> como desee en una página, debe tener en cuenta la posibilidad de problemas de rendimiento.

trans-unit.source: Because of the limited browser support for datetime-local, and the variations in how the inputs work, it may currently still be best to use a framework or library to present these, or to use a custom input of your own. Another option is to use separate date and time inputs, each of which is more widely supported than datetime-local.
trans-unit.target: Debido al soporte limitado del navegador para datetime-local , y las variaciones en cómo funcionan las entradas, actualmente puede ser mejor usar un marco o biblioteca para presentarlas, o usar una entrada personalizada propia. Otra opción es utilizar entradas de date y time separadas , cada una de las cuales es más compatible que datetime-local .

trans-unit.source: Because of these issues, it is generally advised not to use accesskey for most general-purpose websites and web apps.
trans-unit.target: Debido a estos problemas, generalmente se recomienda no usar la accesskey de acceso para la mayoría de los sitios web y aplicaciones web de uso general.

trans-unit.source: Because of these issues, it is generally advised not to use accesskeys for most general-purpose websites and web apps.
Because of this, you should make sure that expected requirement is validated server-side.
Because of this, you should make sure that the accept attribute is backed up by appropriate server-side validation.
trans-unit.target: Debido a esto, debe asegurarse de que el atributo de accept esté respaldado por una validación del lado del servidor adecuada.

trans-unit.source: Because the pixels in a canvas's bitmap can come from a variety of sources, including images or videos retrieved from other hosts, it's inevitable that security problems may arise.
trans-unit.target: Debido a que los pxeles en el mapa de bits de un lienzo pueden provenir de una variedad de fuentes,incluyendo imgenes o videos recuperados de otros anfitriones,es inevitable que surjan problemas de seguridad.

trans-unit.source: Before
trans-unit.target: Before

trans-unit.source: Before 77, Firefox didn't display the value of the label attribute as option text if element's content was empty. See bug 40545.

Before Firefox 12, if JavaScript is disabled, the <canvas> element was being rendered instead of showing the fallback content as per the specification. Since then, the fallback content is rendered instead.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 12, si JavaScript está deshabilitado, el elemento <canvas> se representaba en lugar de mostrar el contenido de respaldo según la especificación. Desde entonces, el contenido de reserva se procesa en su lugar.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 17, the default styling of the <map> HTML element was display: block;. This is now display: inline; and matches the behavior of the other browsers. It was already the case in Quirks Mode.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 17, el estilo predeterminado del elemento HTML <map> era display: block; . Esto ahora se display: inline; y coincide con el comportamiento de los otros navegadores. Ya era el caso en el modo Quirks.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 22, creating an <image> element incorrectly resulted in an HTMLSpanElement object, instead of the expected HTMLElement.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 22, la creación de un elemento <image> daba como resultado incorrectamente un objeto HTMLSpanElement , en lugar del HTMLElement esperado .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 24, although not implemented, an object of class HTMLCommandElement was created, instead of the compliant HTMLUnknownElement.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 24, aunque no implementado, un objeto de clase HTMLCommandElement se creó HTMLCommandElement , en lugar del HTMLUnknownElement compatible .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 35, it was supported in Quirks Mode only.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 35,slo estaba soportado en el modo Quirks.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 4, creating a <kbd> element incorrectly resulted in an HTMLSpanElement object, instead of the expected HTMLElement.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 4, la creación de un elemento <kbd> daba como resultado una HTMLSpanElement objeto HTMLSpanElement , en lugar del HTMLElement esperado .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 4, creating a <strong> element incorrectly resulted in an HTMLSpanElement object, instead of the expected HTMLElement.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 4, la creación incorrecta de un elemento <strong> daba como resultado un objeto HTMLSpanElement , en lugar del HTMLElement esperado .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 4, this element implemented the HTMLSpanElement interface instead of the standard HTMLElement interface.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 4, este elemento implementaba la interfaz HTMLSpanElement en lugar de la interfaz estándar HTMLElement .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 4, this element was implemented using the HTMLSpanElement interface instead of HTMLElement.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 4, este elemento se implementó utilizando la interfaz HTMLSpanElement en lugar de HTMLElement .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 41, it doesn't obey the crossorigin attribute.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 41, no obedecía al atributo crossorigin .

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 5, in Quirks Mode, empty maps were longer skipped over in favor of non-empty ones when matching.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 5,en el modo Quirks,los mapas vacos se saltaban por ms tiempo a favor de los no vacos al emparejar.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 5, in Quirks Mode, empty maps were no longer skipped over in favor of non-empty ones when matching.
Before Firefox 5, the canvas width and height were signed integers instead of unsigned integers.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 5,el ancho y la altura del lienzo eran nmeros enteros firmados en lugar de nmeros enteros sin firmar.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 57, there was a bug meaning that <details> elements can't be made open by default using the open attribute if they have a CSS animation active on them.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 57, había un error que significaba que los elementos <details> no se podían abrir de forma predeterminada utilizando el atributo open si tenían una animation CSS activa en ellos.

trans-unit.source: Before Firefox 6, when a <textarea> was focused, the insertion point was placed at the end of the text by default. Other major browsers place the insertion point at the beginning of the text.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Firefox 6, cuando se enfocaba un <textarea> , el punto de inserción se colocaba al final del texto de forma predeterminada. Otros navegadores importantes colocan el punto de inserción al principio del texto.

trans-unit.source: Before Internet Explorer 7, <base> can be positioned anywhere in the document and the nearest value of <base> is used.
trans-unit.target: Antes de Internet Explorer 7, <base> se puede colocar en cualquier lugar del documento y se usa el valor más cercano de <base> .

trans-unit.source: Before a <dt> or a <dd> element, inside a <dl> or (in WHATWG HTML) a <div> that is inside a <dl>.
trans-unit.target: Antes de un elemento <dt> o <dd> , dentro de un <dl> o (en WHATWG HTML) un <div> que está dentro de un <dl> .

trans-unit.source: Before getting into the intricacies of how date and time strings are written and parsed in HTML, here are some examples that should give you a good idea what the more commonly-used date and time string formats look like.

Before looking at the various formats of date and time related strings used by HTML elements, it is helpful to understand a few fundamental facts about the way they're defined. HTML uses a variation of the ISO 8601 standard for its date and time strings. It's worth reviewing the descriptions of the formats you're using in order to ensure that your strings are in fact compatible with HTML, as the HTML specification includes algorithms for parsing these strings that is actually more precise than ISO 8601, so there can be subtle differences in how date and time strings are expected to look.
Before really getting into styling this table, let's take a moment to add row and column groups to help make our CSS easier.
trans-unit.target: Antes de entrar realmente en el estilo de esta tabla,tomemos un momento para aadir grupos de filas y columnas para ayudar a hacer nuestro CSS ms fcil.

trans-unit.source: Before the alpha option was standardized, you could use the moz-opaque attribute on the canvas tag. However, this only works in Mozilla-based rendering engines and should be avoided; check bug 878155 to track when this attribute will be removed.
trans-unit.target: Antes de que se estandarizara la opción alpha , se podía usar el atributo moz-opaque en la etiqueta de lienzo. Sin embargo, esto solo funciona en motores de renderizado basados en Mozilla y debe evitarse; Verifique el error 878155 para rastrear cuándo se eliminará este atributo.
